page.title: 19DENIS'S VIEW OF DAGENHAM
page.content: Mr.Denis Marshall is 57 years old and has lived in Dagenham all his life. He thinks that Dagenham is not such a nice place to live in as it was years ago.People seem less friendly and shopping facilities are poorer.Big shopping centres such as Romford cater for all needs instead of the local shops.Food shops locally are fine though.He feels that schools,transport services and youth clubs have all deteriorated over the years,and that vandalism and violence have increased. To improve things Denis would employ more street cleaners,have more police on foot patrol,create more areas for children to play safely and to let off steam,and generally tidy up the place.Although he would like to see changes Denis can't imagine how they would come about.
